ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_Fletchers] HELP!
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yes, I noticed that too.  When I sold back the ceramic vane arrows I got a profit (sold for like 6gp + per arrow).  However, when I moved to the next
ygData.messageBody:
>I noticed the same thing when I was getting my fletching up. However, I
>did eventually get my fletching to 200 on Ceramic vane arrows. After I
>hit 187 (seems its a random spot for each person), it took 5 backpacks
>full before I saw a skill increase. The going was definantly slow, but it
>did eventually go up. The only consolance I can offer is that the
>ceramic vane arrows actually sell back to the vendor for more than the
>cost of the parts. I ended up making a 250plat profit from working to
>get my fletching up.
>
>
>Just my 2copper.
>
>Belzarak Bladedancer

Yes, I noticed that too. When I sold back the ceramic vane arrows I
got a profit (sold for like 6gp + per arrow). However, when I moved to the
next component up, which is steel shafts, the arrows actually sold for less
(like 5gp + per arrow) =/. But you say you did get to 200 with ceramic vane
only? Well then I'll switch back to that ... because buying all of the most
expensive components is just soooo expensive to do. Did it take you 5
backpacks or so of components to get each level increase from then on? Or
was it just when you hit 187, and then got easier from then on? Because I
am NOT looking forward to fletching all those arrows =P. But oh well, gotta
keep reminding myself ... want to make darkwood ... WANT to make darkwood!
=) But thank you all ever so much for the input ... guess I'll go back to
fletching those arrows now *wimpers*

Tira Misu of Lanys T'vyl
